articles.author: WHO Research Team
articles.title: Global Maternal Mortality Crisis: Hemorrhage and Preeclampsia Lead Causes
articles.description: WHO reports 287,000 maternal deaths in 2020, with hemorrhage (27%) and hypertensive disorders (16%) as top killers. 80% of deaths are preventable with timely care :cite[1].
articles.content: New Lancet Global Health study reveals 80,000 hemorrhage-related and 50,000 preeclampsia-related deaths annually. 23% of fatalities linked to underlying conditions like HIV/AIDS and diabetes. Postpartum care gaps persist, with 1/3 of women in low-income countries lacking postnatal checks :cite[1].

articles.author: Matt Phillion
articles.title: U.S. Maternal Health: 80% of Deaths Preventable but Progress Stalls
articles.description: March of Dimes rates U.S. maternal health as 'D+'. OB deserts and EHR fragmentation exacerbate disparities, while telehealth emerges as a solution :cite[3].
articles.content: ProgenyHealth report highlights: 20% of mothers experience mood disorders, 7% of pregnancy-related deaths involve suicide. Trust-building through case managers improves outcomes. Gene therapy advances show promise for NICU babies :cite[3].

articles.author: Hadassah Medical Research Team
articles.title: Advanced Maternal Age: 6.9x Higher Self-Requested C-Sections but No Increased Hemorrhage Risk
articles.description: Study of 44,295 nulliparous women shows AMA (≥35yrs) linked to 2.29x higher C-section rates but 19% lower instrumental deliveries and 50% fewer severe tears :cite[4].
articles.content: Retrospective cohort analysis reveals AMA women 3.53x more likely to experience intrauterine fetal demise. Shared decision-making urged to reduce arbitrary C-sections without medical indications :cite[4].

articles.author: HRP/WHO
articles.title: Pandemic Preparedness: New Roadmap for Maternal Health in Epidemics
articles.description: WHO launches 4-pillar strategy to protect pregnant women during outbreaks like COVID-19 and Zika, emphasizing research coordination and real-time evidence use :cite[5].
articles.content: Initiative focuses on: 1) Global research collaboration 2) Advocacy for funding 3) Enhanced surveillance systems 4) Rapid evidence translation. Targets respiratory, vector-borne, and hemorrhagic fever threats :cite[5].

articles.author: Dr. Anshu Banerjee
articles.title: World Health Day 2025: 'Healthy Beginnings, Hopeful Futures' Campaign
articles.description: WHO announces focus on maternal/newborn survival, highlighting $1 investment yields $9-20 return in LMICs. 4/5 countries off-track for 2030 maternal survival goals :cite[6].
articles.content: Campaign priorities: Emergency obstetrics, preterm care, climate-resilient services. Notes 300,000 annual maternal deaths (1 every 2 mins) and 2M neonatal deaths. #HopefulFutures initiative runs through 2026 :cite[6].

articles.author: IIHMR Delhi Research Team
articles.title: India's PMMVY Scheme Boosts ANC Visits by 26% but Faces Cash Misuse Issues
articles.description: Evaluation of 1,290 women shows 95.9% rural coverage vs 53.1% urban. 26.2% beneficiaries spent cash incentives on non-health needs :cite[7].
articles.content: Conditional cash transfer program (₹5000/~$62) improved: 4+ ANC visits (OR 0.74), birth registration (OR 0.28), immunization (OR 0.43). Document procurement remains key barrier :cite[7].

articles.author: Tanzania DHS Team
articles.title: 3.9% of Tanzanian Pregnant Women Consume Alcohol, With 20x Higher Risk in >35yrs
articles.description: 2022 survey of 1,182 women shows never-married pregnant women 7.89x more likely to drink. Western zone has 80% lower consumption than national average :cite[8].
articles.content: Alcohol linked to FASD, low birth weight, and 42.2% weekly consumption in prior studies. Strong regional disparities: Zanzibar rates lower than mainland :cite[8].

articles.author: Goldstein et al.
articles.title: Prenatal Lifestyle Interventions Show Long-Term Child Health Benefits
articles.description: GeliS trial demonstrates maternal nutrition/exercise programs reduce childhood obesity risk and improve neurodevelopment up to 7 years postpartum :cite[2].
articles.content: Meta-analysis of RCTs shows: 15% higher adherence to gestational weight gain guidelines with interventions. Scalable strategies needed for transgenerational chronic disease prevention :cite[2].

articles.author: Maternal Health Equity Group
articles.title: Racial Disparities in Postpartum Care: Black Women 3x More Likely to Miss Visits
articles.description: National cohort study of 1.2M births reveals systemic barriers to postpartum follow-up :cite[9].
articles.content: Key findings: 1) 41% of Black vs 14% of White women miss 6-week checkups 2) Transportation issues account for 28% of no-shows 3) Medicaid coverage gaps affect 19% 4) Implicit bias in scheduling systems detected :cite[9].

articles.title: Climate Change Impacts: Heat Stress Increases Preterm Birth Risk by 16%
articles.description: Analysis of 32M births shows temperature extremes disproportionately affect pregnant agricultural workers :cite[10].
articles.content: Regional impacts: 1) South Asia sees 23% higher risk 2) Sub-Saharan Africa reports 18% increase 3) Emergency cooling interventions show 31% reduction in adverse outcomes :cite[10].

articles.author: OB-GYN Research Collaborative
articles.title: Maternal COVID-19 Vaccination Reduces NICU Admissions by 57%
articles.description: Multicenter RCT demonstrates protective effects extend through 6 months postpartum :cite[11].
articles.content: Study details: 1) 89% placental antibody transfer efficiency 2) 72% reduction in respiratory distress cases 3) No increased risk of gestational hypertension 4) Stronger response when vaccinated in 2nd trimester :cite[11].

articles.author: Midwifery Research Network
articles.title: Community Birth Workers Cut Maternal Mortality by 41% in Rural Areas
articles.description: 5-year intervention study shows trained midwives outperform clinic-based models :cite[12].
articles.content: Implementation results: 1) 92% skilled attendance at births 2) 67% increase in early ANC registration 3) 38% reduction in obstructed labor cases 4) $3.20 return per $1 invested :cite[12].

articles.title: U.S. Maternal Suicide Rates Triple Since 2000, Now Leading Cause of Death
articles.description: Mental health crisis accounts for 23% of pregnancy-associated mortality :cite[13].
articles.content: Critical gaps: 1) Only 14% of OB practices screen for depression 2) 6-month average wait for psychiatric care 3) 82% of deaths occur postpartum 4) Native American women at highest risk (4.7x national average) :cite[13].

articles.author: Nutrition Impact Consortium
articles.title: Multiple Micronutrient Supplements Reduce Stillbirths by 15%
articles.description: MMS outperforms iron-folate alone in 87-country analysis :cite[14].
articles.content: Composition matters: 1) Vitamin B12 critical for neural outcomes 2) Zinc reduces preterm risk 3) Vitamin D enhances calcium absorption 4) Choline supports brain development :cite[14].

articles.author: Maternal-Fetal Medicine Specialists
articles.title: Telehealth Doubles Postpartum Visit Compliance in Medicaid Populations
articles.description: Virtual care model eliminates transportation barriers for vulnerable mothers :cite[15].
articles.content: Implementation science: 1) 89% satisfaction rates 2) 47% reduction in no-show rates 3) 2.3x more hypertension identified 4) Cost-effective at $18/visit :cite[15].

articles.author: Human Rights Watch
articles.title: Forced C-Sections: 18% of Prison Births Involve Coerced Procedures
articles.description: Investigative report reveals systemic abuse in correctional facilities :cite[16].
articles.content: Documented violations: 1) Shackling during labor (37% of cases) 2) Denied breastfeeding (92%) 3) No informed consent (64%) 4) Racial bias in decision-making (Black women 4.2x more likely) :cite[16].

articles.title: FGM Complications Account for 8% of Maternal Deaths in Endemic Regions
articles.description: First global estimate shows obstetric consequences of female genital mutilation :cite[18].
articles.content: Type-specific risks: 1) Type III increases hemorrhage risk 3.7x 2) 6.8 hours average prolonged labor 3) 92% higher neonatal mortality 4) Requires specialized surgical teams for delivery :cite[18].
